body_html:
@Antonio95 Yep, this is a problem with our doc generator. The place that correctly says False is a different thing: it's a convenience method of Variable that calls down to the underlying op.

This would be great to fix, but we may not get to it soon. Contributions would be very welcome!

More background: this documentation is for a Python wrapper automatically generated based on the C++ op definition. The Python wrappers use None as defaults. Is there a good reason for that, @josh11b (I vaguely recall having the discussion but don't remember the result)? In any case, once the Python wrapper has a None default, the generated docs do too since they pull the defaults out of the Python function definition.
